data: Refer to Management of Newborn Hypoglycemia Algorithm (35 weeks and Greater)

Most responsible provider to identify risk factors for hypoglycemia:  - Weight less than 10th percentile SGA - small for gestational age infants  - Intrauterine growth restriction  - Weight over the 90th percentile LGA - large for gestational age infants  - Infants of mothers with diabetes  - Preterm infants - less than 37 weeks gestational age  - UA pH less than or equal to 7.0 / Perinatal asphyxia / Post-resuscitation (see algorithm for definition)  - Infants of mothers who are taking Beta-Blockers (eg. metoprolol, labetalol)  - Metabolic conditions (eg. CPT-1 deficiency)  - Syndromes associated with hypoglycaemia (eg. Beckwith-Wiedemann)
Initiate Management of Newborn Hypoglycemia Algorithm (35 weeks and Greater)

For newborns with risk factors, check blood glucose before feeds at 2, 6, and 12 hours of life. For newborns with special considerations, check blood glucose before feeds at 2, 6, 12, 18 and 24 hours of life

If/when blood glucose is less than 2.6 mmol/L, then for initial supplement: feed newborn 5 mL/kg of donor milk/breast milk/human milk substitute, Check blood glucose 30 minutes post. If blood glucose is less than 2.6 mmol/L then notify provider
